member.name: T:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration
member.summary: Contains global linq2db settings.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.IsStructIsScalarType
F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.UseEnumValueNameForStringColumns
member.summary: If true - Enum values are stored as by calling ToString(). Default value: true.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.ContinueOnCapturedContext
member.summary: Defines value to pass to method for all linq2db internal await operations. Default value: true.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.OptimizeForSequentialAccess
member.summary: Enables mapping expression to be compatible with behavior. Note that it doesn't switch linq2db to use behavior for queries, so this optimization could be used for too. Default value: false.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.MaxBinaryParameterLengthLogging
member.summary: Determines the length after which logging of binary data in SQL will be truncated. This is to avoid Out-Of-Memory exceptions when getting SqlText from or for logging or other purposes.
member.remarks: This value defaults to 100. Use a value of -1 to disable and always log full binary. Set to 0 to truncate all binary data.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.MaxStringParameterLengthLogging
member.summary: Determines the length after which logging of string data in SQL will be truncated. This is to avoid Out-Of-Memory exceptions when getting SqlText from or for logging or other purposes.
member.remarks: This value defaults to 200. Use a value of -1 to disable and always log full string. Set to 0 to truncate all string data.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Data.ThrowOnDisposed
member.summary: Enables throwing of when access disposed instance. Default value: true.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Data.BulkCopyUseConnectionCommandTimeout
member.summary: Controls behavior of bulk copy timeout if is not provided. - if true - the current timeout on the is used - if false - command timeout is infinite. Default value: false.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq
member.summary: LINQ query settings.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.PreloadGroups
member.summary: Controls how group data for LINQ queries ended with GroupBy will be loaded: - if true - group data will be loaded together with main query, resulting in 1 + N queries, where N - number of groups; - if false - group data will be loaded when you call enumerator for specific group . Default value: false.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.IgnoreEmptyUpdate
member.summary: Controls behavior of linq2db when there is no updateable fields in Update query: - if true - query not executed and Update operation returns 0 as number of affected records; - if false - will be thrown. Default value: false.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.AllowMultipleQuery
member.summary: Controls behavior of linq2db when multiple queries required to load requested data: - if true - multiple queries allowed; - if false - will be thrown. This option required, if you want to select related collections, e.g. using method. Default value: false.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.GenerateExpressionTest
member.summary: Enables generation of test class for each LINQ query, executed while this option is enabled. This option could be useful for issue reporting, when you need to provide reproducible case. Test file will be placed to linq2db subfolder of temp folder and exact file path will be logged to data connection tracing infrastructure. See for more details. Default value: false.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.TraceMapperExpression
member.summary: Enables logging of generated mapping expression to data connection tracing infrastructure. See for more details. Default value: false.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.DoNotClearOrderBys
member.summary: Controls behavior, when LINQ query chain contains multiple or calls: - if true - non-first OrderBy* call will be treated as ThenBy* call; - if false - OrderBy* call will discard sort specifications, added by previous OrderBy* and ThenBy* calls. Default value: false.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.OptimizeJoins
F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.CompareNullsAsValues
member.summary: If set to true nullable fields would be checked for IS NULL in Equal/NotEqual comparisons. This affects: Equal, NotEqual, Not Contains Default value: true.
member.example:
public class MyEntity { public int? Value; }
db.MyEntity.Where(e => e.Value != 10)
from e1 in db.MyEntity join e2 in db.MyEntity on e1.Value equals e2.Value select e1
var filter = new [] {1, 2, 3}; db.MyEntity.Where(e => ! filter.Contains(e.Value))
Would be converted to next queries:
SELECT Value FROM MyEntity WHERE Value IS NULL OR Value != 10
SELECT e1.Value FROM MyEntity e1 INNER JOIN MyEntity e2 ON e1.Value = e2.Value OR (e1.Value IS NULL AND e2.Value IS NULL)
SELECT Value FROM MyEntity WHERE Value IS NULL OR NOT Value IN (1, 2, 3)

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.GuardGrouping
member.summary: Controls behavior of LINQ query, which ends with GroupBy call. - if true - will be thrown for such queries; - if false - behavior is controlled by option. Default value: true.
member.remarks: More details.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.DisableQueryCache
member.summary:
Used to disable LINQ expressions caching for queries. This cache reduces time, required for query parsing but have several side-effects:
- cached LINQ expressions could contain references to external objects as parameters, which could lead to memory leaks if those objects are not used anymore by other code
- cache access synchronization could lead to bigger latencies than it saves.
Default value: false.
It is not recommended to enable this option as it could lead to severe slowdown. Better approach will be to call method to cleanup cache after queries, that produce severe memory leaks you need to fix.
More details.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.CacheSlidingExpiration
member.summary: Specifies timeout when query will be evicted from cache since last execution of query. Default value is 1 hour.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.PreferApply
member.summary: Used to generate CROSS APPLY or OUTER APPLY if possible. Default value: true.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.KeepDistinctOrdered
member.summary: Allows SQL generation to automatically transform SELECT DISTINCT value FROM Table ORDER BY date Into GROUP BY equivalent if syntax is not supported Default value: true.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Linq.ParameterizeTakeSkip
member.summary: Enables Take/Skip parameterization. Default value: true.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.SqlServer
member.summary: SqlServer specific global settings.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.SqlServer.UseSchemaOnlyToGetSchema
member.summary: if set to true, SchemaProvider uses to get metadata. Otherwise the sp_describe_first_result_set sproc is used. Default value: false.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.LinqService
member.summary: Linq over WCF global settings.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.LinqService.SerializeAssemblyQualifiedName
member.summary: Controls format of type name, sent over remote context: - if true - name from used; - if false - name from used. Default value: false.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.LinqService.ThrowUnresolvedTypeException
member.summary: Controls behavior of linq2db, when it cannot load by type name on query deserialization: - if true - will be thrown; - if false - type load error will be ignored. Default value: false.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.RetryPolicy
member.summary: Retry policy global settings.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.RetryPolicy.Factory
member.summary: Retry policy factory method, used to create retry policy for new instance. If factory method is not set, retry policy is not used. Not set by default.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.RetryPolicy.UseDefaultPolicy
member.summary: Status of use of default retry policy. Getter returns true if default retry policy used, and false if custom retry policy used or retry policy is not set. Setter sets to default retry policy factory if is true, otherwise removes retry policy.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.RetryPolicy.DefaultMaxRetryCount
member.summary: The default number of retry attempts. Default value: 5.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.RetryPolicy.DefaultMaxDelay
member.summary: The default maximum time delay between retries, must be nonnegative. Default value: 30 seconds.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.RetryPolicy.DefaultRandomFactor
member.summary: The default maximum random factor, must not be lesser than 1. Default value: 1.1.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.RetryPolicy.DefaultExponentialBase
member.summary: The default base for the exponential function used to compute the delay between retries, must be positive. Default value: 2.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.RetryPolicy.DefaultCoefficient
member.summary: The default coefficient for the exponential function used to compute the delay between retries, must be nonnegative. Default value: 1 second.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Sql
member.summary: SQL generation global settings.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Sql.AssociationAlias
member.summary:
Format for association alias.
Default value: "a_{0}".
In the following query
var query = from child in db.Child select new { child.ChildID, child.Parent.Value1 };
for association Parent will be generated association A_Parent in resulting SQL.
SELECT [child].[ChildID], [a_Parent].[Value1] FROM [Child] [child] LEFT JOIN [Parent] [a_Parent] ON ([child].[ParentID] = [a_Parent].[ParentID])
Set this value to null to disable special alias generation queries.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Common.Configuration.Sql.GenerateFinalAliases
member.summary:
Indicates whether SQL Builder should generate aliases for final projection. It is not required for correct query processing but simplifies SQL analysis.
Default value: false.
For the query
var query = from child in db.Child select new { TrackId = child.ChildID, };
When property is true
SELECT [child].[ChildID] as [TrackId] FROM [Child] [child]
Otherwise alias will be removed
SELECT [child].[ChildID] FROM [Child] [child]

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Configuration.IDataProviderSettings.Attributes
member.summary:
Extra provider-specific parameters.
Sybase:
assemblyName - Sybase provider assembly name.
SAP HANA:
assemblyName - SAP HANA provider assembly name.
Oracle:
assemblyName - Oracle provider assembly name.
SQL Server:
assemblyName - provider assembly name. Recognized values: "System.Data", "System.Data.SqlClient", "Microsoft.Data.SqlClient".
version - T-SQL support level, recognized values: "2000", "2005", "2012", "2014". Default: "2008".
DB2:
version - DB2 platform, recognized values: "zOS" or "z/OS" - DB2 for z/OS. Default platform - DB2 LUW.

Default provider configured using option and set to by default.

member.summary: Counts number of locks, put on underlying connection. Connection will not be released while counter is not zero.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.DataContext.CommandTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets command execution timeout in seconds. Negative timeout value means that default timeout will be used. 0 timeout value corresponds to infinite timeout. By default timeout is not set and default value for current provider used.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataContext._dataConnection
member.summary: Underlying active database connection.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataContext.CreateDataConnection
member.summary: Creates instance of class, used by context internally.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataContext.GetDataConnection
member.summary: Returns associated database connection or create new connection, if connection doesn't exists.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataContext.ReleaseQuery
member.summary: For active underlying connection, updates information about last executed query and releases connection, if it is not locked () and is false.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataContext.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Noop constructor for context cloning.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataContext.CloneDataConnection(LinqToDB.Data.DataConnection,LinqToDB.Async.IAsyncDbTransaction,LinqToDB.Async.IAsyncDbConnection)
member.summary: Creates instance of class, attached to same database connection/transaction. Used by API only if is true and there is an active connection associated with current context. and parameters are mutually exclusive. One and only one parameter will have value - if there is active transaction, parameter value provided, otherwise parameter has value.
member.param: instance, used by current context instance.

member.name: E:LinqToDB.DataContext.OnClosing
member.summary: Event, triggered before underlying connection closed on context disposal or closing. Not fired, if context doesn't have active connection (bug?).

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataContext.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Closes underlying connection and fires event (only if connection existed).

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataContext.DisposeAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Closes underlying connection and fires event (only if connection existed).

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataContext.Close
member.summary: Closes underlying connection and fires event (only if connection existed).

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataExtensions.CreateTable``1(LinqToDB.IDataContext,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,LinqToDB.SqlQuery.DefaultNullable,System.String,LinqToDB.TableOptions)
member.summary: Creates new table in database for mapping class . Information about table name, columns names and types is taken from mapping class.
member.param: Optional table name to override default table name, extracted from mapping.
Optional database name, to override default database name. See method for support information per provider.
Optional schema/owner name, to override default name. See method for support information per provider.
Optional replacement for "CREATE TABLE table_name" header. Header is a template with {0} parameter for table name.
Optional SQL, appended to generated create table statement.

Defines how columns nullability flag should be generated:
- - generate only NOT NULL for non-nullable fields. Missing nullability information treated as NULL by database.
- - generate only NULL for nullable fields. Missing nullability information treated as NOT NULL by database.
- - explicitly generate NULL and NOT NULL for all columns. Default value: .
Optional linked server name. See method for support information per provider.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataExtensions.FromSql``1(LinqToDB.IDataContext,System.FormattableString)

summary.para: Creates a LINQ query based on an interpolated string representing a SQL query.

If the database provider supports composing on the supplied SQL, you can compose on top of the raw SQL query using LINQ operators - context.FromSql<Blogs>("SELECT * FROM dbo.Blogs").OrderBy(b => b.Name);

As with any API that accepts SQL it is important to parameterize any user input to protect against a SQL injection attack. You can include interpolated parameter place holders in the SQL query string. Any interpolated parameter values you supply will automatically be converted to a DbParameter - context.FromSql<Blogs>($"SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SearchBlogs]({userSuppliedSearchTerm})");

member.param: The interpolated string representing a SQL query.
member.remarks: Additional parentheses will be added to the query if first word in raw query is 'SELECT', otherwise users are responsible to add them themselves.
member.returns: An representing the raw SQL query.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataExtensions.FromSqlScalar``1(LinqToDB.IDataContext,System.FormattableString)

summary.para: Creates a LINQ query based on an interpolated string representing a SQL query.

If the database provider supports composing on the supplied SQL, you can compose on top of the raw SQL query using LINQ operators - context.FromSql<Blogs>("SELECT * FROM dbo.Blogs").OrderBy(b => b.Name);

As with any API that accepts SQL it is important to parameterize any user input to protect against a SQL injection attack. You can include interpolated parameter place holders in the SQL query string. Any interpolated parameter values you supply will automatically be converted to a DbParameter - context.FromSqlScalar<Blogs>($"UNNEST({array})");

member.param: The interpolated string representing a SQL query.
member.remarks: Additional parentheses will be added to the query if first word in raw query is 'SELECT', otherwise users are responsible to add them themselves.
member.returns: An representing the raw SQL query.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataExtensions.FromSql``1(LinqToDB.IDataContext,LinqToDB.Common.RawSqlString,System.Object[])

summary.para: Creates a LINQ query based on a raw SQL query.

If the database provider supports composing on the supplied SQL, you can compose on top of the raw SQL query using LINQ operators - context.FromSql<Blogs>("SELECT * FROM dbo.Blogs").OrderBy(b => b.Name);

As with any API that accepts SQL it is important to parametrize any user input to protect against a SQL injection attack. You can include parameter place holders in the SQL query string and then supply parameter values as additional arguments. Any parameter values you supply will automatically be converted to a DbParameter - context.FromSql<Blogs>("SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SearchBlogs]({0})", userSuppliedSearchTerm);

This overload also accepts DbParameter instances as parameter values. context.FromSql<Blogs>("SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SearchBlogs]({0})", new DataParameter("@searchTerm", userSuppliedSearchTerm, DataType.Int64));

member.param: The values to be assigned to parameters.
member.remarks: Additional parentheses will be added to the query if first word in raw query is 'SELECT', otherwise users are responsible to add them themselves.
member.returns: An representing the raw SQL query.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataExtensions.SelectQuery``1(LinqToDB.IDataContext,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0}})

summary.para:
Creates a LINQ query based on expression. Returned represents single record.
Could be useful for function calls, querying of database variables, properties or sub-queries.

member.remarks:
Method works for most supported database engines, except databases which do not support SELECT Value without FROM statement.
For Oracle it will be translated to SELECT Value FROM SYS.DUAL

member.name: P:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Firebird.FirebirdConfiguration.IdentifierQuoteMode
member.summary: Specifies how identifiers like table and field names should be quoted.
member.remarks: Default value: .

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Firebird.FirebirdConfiguration.IsLiteralEncodingSupported
member.summary: Specifies that Firebird supports literal encoding. Availiable from version 2.5.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Firebird.FirebirdIdentifierQuoteMode
member.summary: Possible modes for Firebird identifier quotes. This enumeration covers only identifier quotation logic and don't handle identifier length limits.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Firebird.FirebirdIdentifierQuoteMode.None
member.summary: Do not quote identifiers. LINQ To DB will not check identifiers for validity (spaces, reserved words) is this mode. This mode should be used only for SQL Dialect < 3 and it is developer's responsibility to ensure that there is no identifiers in use that require quotation.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Firebird.FirebirdIdentifierQuoteMode.Quote
member.summary: Always quote identifiers. LINQ To DB will quote all identifiers, even if it is not required. Select this mode, if you need to preserve identifiers casing. Quoted identifiers not supported by SQL Dialect < 3.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Firebird.FirebirdIdentifierQuoteMode.Auto
member.summary: Quote identifiers if needed. LINQ To DB will quote identifiers, if they are not valid without quotation. This includes: - use of reserved words; - use of any characters except latin letters, digits, _ and $; - use digit, _ or $ as first character. This is default mode. Note that if you need to preserve casing of identifiers, you should use mode. Quoted identifiers not supported by SQL Dialect < 3.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Firebird.FirebirdProviderAdapter.FbDecFloatType
member.summary: FB client 7.10.0+.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Firebird.FirebirdSqlBuilder.IsValidIdentifier(System.String)
member.summary: Check if identifier is valid without quotation. Expects non-zero length string as input.

member.param: Data connection instance used with scope.
member.returns: Returns disposable scope object. Cannot be null.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Informix.InformixConfiguration.ExplicitFractionalSecondsSeparator
member.summary: Enables use of explicit fractional seconds separator in datetime values. Must be enabled for Informix starting from v11.70.xC8 and v12.10.xC2. More details at: https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSGU8G_12.1.0/com.ibm.po.doc/new_features_ce.htm#newxc2__xc2_datetime

member.name: P:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Informix.InformixProviderAdapter.IsIDSProvider
member.summary: IDS or SQLI provider.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Informix.InformixSqlBuilder.IsValidIdentifier(System.String)
member.summary: Check if identifier is valid without quotation. Expects non-zero length string as input.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlBulkCopy.MaxParameters
member.summary: Settings based on https://www.jooq.org/doc/3.12/manual/sql-building/dsl-context/custom-settings/settings-inline-threshold/ MySQL supports more but realistically this might be too much already for practical cases.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlBulkCopy.MaxSqlLength
member.summary: MySQL can support much larger sizes, based on https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/server-system-variables.html#sysvar_max_allowed_packet But we keep a smaller number here to avoid choking the network.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.MatchModifier
member.summary: Search modifier for MATCH AGAINST full-text search predicate.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.MatchModifier.NaturalLanguage
member.summary: Applies 'IN NATURAL LANGUAGE MODE' (default value) search modifier.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.MatchModifier.Boolean
member.summary: Applies 'IN BOOLEAN MODE' (default value) search modifier.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.MatchModifier.WithQueryExpansion
member.summary: Applies 'IN NATURAL LANGUAGE MODE WITH QUERY EXPANSION'/'WITH QUERY EXPANSION' search modifier.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.Match(LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.IMySqlExtensions,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Applies full-text search condition using MATCH AGAINST predicate against specified full-text columns using default mode (IN NATURAL LANGUAGE MODE). Example: MATCH(col1, col2) AGAINST('search query').
member.param: Full-text columns that should be queried.
member.returns: Returns true if full-text search found matching records.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.MatchRelevance(LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.IMySqlExtensions,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Calculates relevance of full-text search for current record using MATCH AGAINST predicate against specified full-text columns using default mode (IN NATURAL LANGUAGE MODE). Example: MATCH(col1, col2) AGAINST('search query').
member.param: Full-text columns that should be queried.
member.returns: Returns full-text search relevance value for current record.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.Match(LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.IMySqlExtensions,LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.MatchModifier,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Applies full-text search condition using MATCH AGAINST predicate against specified full-text columns using specified search modifier. Example: MATCH(col1, col2) AGAINST('search query' MODIFIER).
member.param: Full-text columns that should be queried.
member.returns: Returns true if full-text search found matching records.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.MatchRelevance(LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.IMySqlExtensions,LinqToDB.DataProvider.MySql.MySqlExtensions.MatchModifier,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Calculates relevance of full-text search for current record using MATCH AGAINST predicate against specified full-text columns using specified search modifier. Example: MATCH(col1, col2) AGAINST('search query' MODIFIER).
member.param: Full-text columns that should be queried.
member.returns: Returns full-text search relevance value for current record.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Oracle.Oracle11SqlOptimizer.ReplaceTakeSkipWithRowNum(LinqToDB.SqlQuery.SqlStatement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Replaces Take/Skip by ROWNUM usage. See 'Pagination with ROWNUM' for more information.
member.param: Statement which may contain take/skip modifiers.
Indicates when transformation needed only for subqueries.
member.returns: The same or modified statement when optimization has been performed.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Oracle.OracleBulkCopy._maxParameters
member.remarks: Settings based on https://www.jooq.org/doc/3.12/manual/sql-building/dsl-context/custom-settings/settings-inline-threshold/ We subtract 1 based on possibility of provider using parameter for command.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Oracle.OracleBulkCopy._maxSqlLength
member.summary: Setting is conservative, based on https://docs.oracle.com/cd/A58617_01/server.804/a58242/ch5.htm Max is actually more arbitrary in later versions than Oracle 8.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Oracle.OracleTools.DontEscapeLowercaseIdentifiers
member.summary: Gets or sets flag to tell LinqToDB to quote identifiers, if they contain lowercase letters. Default value: false. This flag is added for backward compatibility and not recommended for use with new applications.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.PostgreSQL.NpgsqlProviderAdapter.NpgsqlBinaryImporter.Cancel
member.summary: Npgsql 3.x provides Cancel method. Npgsql 4.x uses Complete method. https://github.com/npgsql/npgsql/issues/1646.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.DataProvider.PostgreSQL.PostgreSQLBulkCopy.MaxParameters
member.remarks: Settings based on https://www.jooq.org/doc/3.12/manual/sql-building/dsl-context/custom-settings/settings-inline-threshold/ We subtract 1 based on possibility of provider using parameter for command.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.DataProvider.PostgreSQL.PostgreSQLBulkCopy.MaxSqlLength
member.summary: Setting based on https://stackoverflow.com/a/4937695/2937845 Max is actually 2GiB, but we keep a lower number here to avoid the cost of huge statements.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.PostgreSQL.PostgreSQLDataProvider._npgsqlTypeMap
member.summary: Map of canonical PostgreSQL type name to NpgsqlDbType enumeration value. This map shouldn't be used directly, you should resolve PostgreSQL types using method, which takes into account different type aliases.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.PostgreSQL.PostgreSQLDataProvider.GetNativeType(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns enumeration value for requested postgresql type or null if type cannot be resolved. This method expects correct PostgreSQL type as input. Custom types not supported. Also could fail on some types as PostgreSQL have a lot of ways to write same type.
member.remarks: Returned value could be invalid for type, if range/array flags were applied. Don't try to use results of this function for anything except passing it directly to npgsql.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlCe.SqlCeConfiguration.InlineFunctionParameters
member.summary: Enables force inlining of function parameters to support SQL CE 3.0. Default value: false.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SQLite.SQLiteBulkCopy.MaxParameters
member.remarks: Settings based on https://www.jooq.org/doc/3.12/manual/sql-building/dsl-context/custom-settings/settings-inline-threshold/ We subtract 1 based on possibility of ADO Provider using parameter for command.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SQLite.SQLiteBulkCopy.MaxSqlLength
member.remarks: Based on https://www.sqlite.org/limits.html. Since SQLite is parsed locally by the lib, we aren't worried about network congestion and keep the max.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SQLite.SQLiteDataProvider.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates the specified SQLite provider based on the provider name.
member.param: If ProviderName.SQLite is provided, the detection mechanism preferring System.Data.SQLite to Microsoft.Data.Sqlite will be used.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SQLite.SQLiteExtensions.Match(LinqToDB.DataProvider.SQLite.ISQLiteExtensions,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Applies full-text search condition using MATCH predicate against whole FTS table or specific column. Examples: "table MATCH 'search query'"/"table.column MATCH 'search query'".
member.param: Table or column to perform full-text search against.
member.returns: Returns true if full-text search found matching records.
member.remarks: FTS Support: FTS3/4, FTS5.

member.summary: Performs full-text search query against against speficied table and returns search results. Example: "table('search query')".
member.param: Table to perform full-text search against.
member.returns: Returns table, filtered using specified search condition, applied to whole table.
member.remarks: FTS Support: FTS5.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.DataProvider.SqlServer.SqlServerBulkCopy.MaxSqlLength

member.name: P:LinqToDB.DataProvider.Sybase.SybaseTools.DefaultBulkCopyType
member.summary: Using mode with bit and identity fields could lead to following errors: - bit: false inserted into bit field for first record even if true provided; - identity: bulk copy operation fail with exception: "Bulk insert failed. Null value is not allowed in not null column.". Those are provider bugs and could be fixed in latest versions.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.CallOnExceptionRegion
member.summary: Implements disposable region, which will call provided action, if region execution terminated due to exception.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.DataType
member.summary: List of data types, supported by linq2db. Provider-level support depends on database capabilities and current implementation support level and could vary for different providers.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Undefined
member.summary: Undefined data type.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Char
member.summary: A fixed-length stream of non-Unicode characters ranging between 1 and 8,000 characters.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.VarChar
member.summary: A variable-length stream of non-Unicode characters ranging between 1 and 8,000 characters. Use VarChar when the database column is varchar(max).

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Text
member.summary: A variable-length stream of non-Unicode data with a maximum length of 2 31 -1 (or 2,147,483,647) characters.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.NChar
member.summary: A fixed-length stream of Unicode characters ranging between 1 and 4,000 characters.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.NVarChar
member.summary:
A variable-length stream of Unicode characters ranging between 1 and 4,000 characters. Implicit conversion fails if the string is greater than 4,000 characters. Oracle: We need NVarChar2 in order to insert UTF8 string values. The default Odp VarChar2 dbtype doesnt work with UTF8 values. Note : Microsoft oracle client uses NVarChar value by default.
Same as VARCHAR2 except that the column stores values in the National CS , ie you can store values in Bangla if your National CS is BN8BSCII .If the National CS is of fixed width CS (all characters are represented by a fixed byte ,say 2 bytes for JA16EUCFIXED) , then NVARCHAR2(30) stores 30 Characters. Varchar2 works with 8 bit characters where as Nvarchar2 works ith 16 bit characters. If you have to store data other than english prefer Nvarchar2 or viceversa.
NCHAR and NVARCHAR2 are Unicode datatypes that store Unicode character data. The character set of NCHAR and NVARCHAR2 datatypes can only be either AL16UTF16 or UTF8 and is specified at database creation time as the national character set. AL16UTF16 and UTF8 are both Unicode encoding. The NCHAR datatype stores fixed-length character strings that correspond to the national character set.The NVARCHAR2 datatype stores variable length character strings. When you create a table with an NCHAR or NVARCHAR2 column, the maximum size specified is always in character length semantics. Character length semantics is the default and only length semantics for NCHAR or NVARCHAR2. For example, if national character set is UTF8, then the following statement defines the maximum byte length of 90 bytes: CREATE TABLE tab1 (col1 NCHAR(30)); This statement creates a column with maximum character length of 30. The maximum byte length is the multiple of the maximum character length and the maximum number of bytes in each character. The maximum length of an NVARCHAR2 column is 4000 bytes. It can hold up to 4000 characters. The actual data is subject to the maximum byte limit of 4000. The two size constraints must be satisfied simultaneously at run time.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.NText
member.summary: A variable-length stream of Unicode data with a maximum length of 2 30 - 1 (or 1,073,741,823) characters.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Binary
member.summary: A fixed-length stream of binary data ranging between 1 and 8,000 bytes.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.VarBinary
member.summary: A variable-length stream of binary data ranging between 1 and 8,000 bytes. Implicit conversion fails if the byte array is greater than 8,000 bytes.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Blob
member.summary: Binary large object.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Image
member.summary: A variable-length stream of binary data ranging from 0 to 2 31 -1 (or 2,147,483,647) bytes.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Boolean
member.summary: A simple type representing Boolean values of true or false.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Guid
member.summary: A globally unique identifier (or GUID).

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.SByte
member.summary: An integral type representing signed 8-bit integers with values between -128 and 127.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Int16
member.summary: An integral type representing signed 16-bit integers with values between -32768 and 32767.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Int32
member.summary: An integral type representing signed 32-bit integers with values between -2147483648 and 2147483647.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Int64
member.summary: An integral type representing signed 64-bit integers with values between -9223372036854775808 and 9223372036854775807.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Byte
member.summary: An 8-bit unsigned integer ranging in value from 0 to 255.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.UInt16
member.summary: An integral type representing unsigned 16-bit integers with values between 0 and 65535.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.UInt32
member.summary: An integral type representing unsigned 32-bit integers with values between 0 and 4294967295.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.UInt64
member.summary: An integral type representing unsigned 64-bit integers with values between 0 and 18446744073709551615.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Single
member.summary: A floating point number within the range of -3.40E +38 through 3.40E +38.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Double
member.summary: A floating point number within the range of -1.79E +308 through 1.79E +308.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Decimal
member.summary: A simple type representing values with fixed precision and scale numbers. When maximum precision is used, valid values are from -10^38+1 through 10^38-1.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Money
member.summary: A currency value ranging from -2 63 (or -9,223,372,036,854,775,808) to 2 63 -1 (or +9,223,372,036,854,775,807) with an accuracy to a ten-thousandth of a currency unit.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.SmallMoney
member.summary: A currency value ranging from -214,748.3648 to +214,748.3647 with an accuracy to a ten-thousandth of a currency unit.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Date
member.summary: A type representing a date value.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Time
member.summary: A type representing a time value.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.DateTime
member.summary: Date and time data ranging in value from January 1, 1753 to December 31, 9999 to an accuracy of 3.33 milliseconds.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.DateTime2
member.summary: Date and time data. Date value range is from January 1,1 AD through December 31, 9999 AD. Time value range is 00:00:00 through 23:59:59.9999999 with an accuracy of 100 nanoseconds.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.SmallDateTime
member.summary: Date and time data ranging in value from January 1, 1900 to June 6, 2079 to an accuracy of one minute.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.DateTimeOffset
member.summary: Date and time data with time zone awareness. Date value range is from January 1,1 AD through December 31, 9999 AD. Time value range is 00:00:00 through 23:59:59.9999999 with an accuracy of 100 nanoseconds. Time zone value range is -14:00 through +14:00.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Timestamp
member.summary: Array of type Byte. Automatically generated binary numbers, which are guaranteed to be unique within a database. timestamp is used typically as a mechanism for version-stamping table rows. The storage size is 8 bytes.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Xml
member.summary: An XML value. Obtain the XML as a string using the GetValue method or Value property, or as an XmlReader by calling the CreateReader method.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Variant
member.summary: A general type representing any reference or value type not explicitly represented by another DataType value.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.VarNumeric
member.summary: A variable-length numeric value.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Udt
member.summary: A SQL Server 2005 user-defined type (UDT).

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.BitArray

member.name: F:LinqToDB.DataType.Int128
member.summary: An integral type representing signed 128-bit integers with values between -170141183460469231731687303715884105728 and 170141183460469231731687303715884105727.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions
member.summary: Defines behavior of method.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.MaxBatchSize
member.summary: Number of rows in each batch. At the end of each batch, the rows in the batch are sent to the server.
member.returns: The integer value of the property, or zero if no value has been set.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.KeepIdentity
member.summary: If this option set to true, bulk copy will use values of columns, marked with IsIdentity flag. SkipOnInsert flag in this case will be ignored. Otherwise those columns will be skipped and values will be generated by server. Not compatible with mode.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.ServerName
member.summary: Gets or sets explicit name of target server instead of one, configured for copied entity in mapping schema. See method for support information per provider. Also note that it is not supported by provider-specific insert method.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.DatabaseName
member.summary: Gets or sets explicit name of target database instead of one, configured for copied entity in mapping schema. See method for support information per provider.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.SchemaName
member.summary: Gets or sets explicit name of target schema/owner instead of one, configured for copied entity in mapping schema. See method for support information per provider.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.TableName
member.summary: Gets or sets explicit name of target table instead of one, configured for copied entity in mapping schema.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.TableOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets flags overrides instead of configured for copied entity in mapping schema. See method for support information per provider.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.NotifyAfter
member.summary: Gets or sets counter after how many copied records should be called. E.g. if you set it to 10, callback will be called after each 10 copied records. To disable callback, set this option to 0 (default value).

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.RowsCopiedCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets callback method that will be called by BulkCopy operation after each rows copied. This callback will not be used if set to 0.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.UseParameters
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to Always use Parameters for MultipleRowsCopy. Default is false. If True, provider's override for will be used to determine the maximum number of rows per insert, Unless overridden by .

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyOptions.MaxParametersForBatch
member.summary: If set, will override the Maximum parameters per batch statement from .

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyRowsCopied.Abort
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the bulk copy operation should be aborted.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyRowsCopied.RowsCopied
member.summary: Gets a value that returns the number of rows copied during the current bulk copy operation.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyRowsCopied.StartTime
member.summary: Gets operation execution start time.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyType
member.summary: Bulk copy implementation type. For more details on support level by provider see this article.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyType.Default
member.summary: LINQ To DB will select copy method based on current provider. Default method usually set at [PROVIDER_NAME_HERE]Tools.DefaultBulkCopyType.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyType.RowByRow
member.summary: Data will be inserted into table as a sequence of selects, row by row.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyType.MultipleRows
member.summary: Data will be inserted into table as a batch insert using INSERT FROM SELECT or similar code. If method not supported, it will be downgraded to method.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.Data.BulkCopyType.ProviderSpecific
member.summary: Data will be inserted using native bulk copy functionality if supported. If method not supported, it will be downgraded to method.

member.summary: Gets maping schema, used for current connection.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.DataConnection.InlineParameters
member.summary: Gets or sets option to force inline parameter values as literals into command text. If parameter inlining not supported for specific value type, it will be used as parameter.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.DataConnection.QueryHints
member.summary: Gets list of query hints (writable collection), that will be used for all queries, executed through current connection.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Data.DataConnection.NextQueryHints
member.summary: Gets list of query hints (writable collection), that will be used only for next query, executed through current connection.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.Data.DataConnection.AddMappingSchema(LinqToDB.Mapping.MappingSchema)
member.summary: Adds additional mapping schema to current connection.
member.remarks: will share instances that were created by combining same mapping schemas.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.Data.DataConnection.Clone
member.summary: Clones current connection.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.Data.DataConnection.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes connection.

member.summary: Returns queryable source for specified mapping class for current connection, mapped to database table or view.

- type should have default constructor.
- if at least one property or field has , then properties that are not marked with will be ignored.
- if there is missing index in properties that are marked with , then result set under missing index will be ignored.
- if there is no , then all non readonly fields or properties with setter will read from multiple result set. Order is based on their appearance in class.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.Expressions.MemberHelper.GetMemberInfo(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression)
member.summary: Gets the member information from given expression.
member.remarks:
Returns member information for given expressions, e.g.:
For: x => x.SomeProperty, returns MemberInfo of SomeProperty.
For: x => x.SomeMethod(), returns MethodInfo of SomeMethod.
For: x => new { X = x.Name }, return ConstructorInfo of anonymous type.
For: x => Sql.Property<int>(x, "SomeProperty"), returns MemberInfo of "SomeProperty" if exists on type, otherwise returns DynamicColumnInfo for SomeProperty on given type.
member.exception: Only simple, non-navigational, member names are supported in this context (e.g.: x => Sql.Property(x, \"SomeProperty\")).

member.name: M:LinqToDB.LinqExtensions.TableName``1(LinqToDB.ITable{``0},System.String)
member.summary: Overrides table or view name with new name for current query.
member.returns: Table-like query source with new name.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.LinqExtensions.DatabaseName``1(LinqToDB.ITable{``0},System.String)
member.summary:
Overrides database name with new name for current query. This call will have effect only for databases that support database name in fully-qualified table name.
Supported by: Access, DB2, MySQL, PostgreSQL, SAP HANA, SQLite, Informix, SQL Server, Sybase ASE.
Requires schema name (see ): DB2, SAP HANA, PostgreSQL.
PostgreSQL supports only name of current database.
member.returns: Table-like query source with new database name.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.LinqExtensions.ServerName``1(LinqToDB.ITable{``0},System.String)
member.summary:
Overrides linked server name with new name for current query. This call will have effect only for databases that support linked server name in fully-qualified table name.
Supported by: SQL Server, Informix, Oracle, SAP HANA2.
member.returns: Table-like query source with new linked server name.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.LinqExtensions.SchemaName``1(LinqToDB.ITable{``0},System.String)
member.summary:
Overrides owner/schema name with new name for current query. This call will have effect only for databases that support owner/schema name in fully-qualified table name.
Supported by: DB2, Oracle, PostgreSQL, Informix, SQL Server, Sybase ASE.
member.returns: Table-like query source with new owner/schema name.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.LinqExtensions.Set``1(System.Linq.IQueryable{``0},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.String}})
member.summary: Adds update field expression to query. It can be any expression with string interpolation.
member.param: Source query with records to update.
member.example:
The following example shows how to append string value to appropriate field.
db.Users.Where(u => u.UserId == id) .Set(u => $"{u.Name}" += {str}") .Update();

member.example:
The following example shows how to append string value to appropriate field.
db.Users.Where(u => u.UserId == id) .AsUpdatable() .Set(u => $"{u.Name}" += {str}") .Update();

Key fields selector to specify what fields and values must be used as key fields for selection between insert and update operations. Expression supports only target table record new expression with field initializers for each key field. Assigned key field value will be used as key value by operation type selector.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.LinqExtensions.LoadWithAsTable``1(LinqToDB.ITable{``0},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Object}})
M:LinqToDB.LinqExtensions.LoadWith``2(System.Linq.IQueryable{``0},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,``1}})
member.summary: Specifies associations that should be loaded for each loaded record from current table. All associations, specified in expression, will be loaded. Take into account that use of this method could require multiple queries to load all requested associations.

para.para:
Following query loads records from Table1 with Reference association, loaded for each Table1 record.
db.Table1.LoadWith(r => r.Reference);

Following query loads records from Table1 with References collection association loaded for each Table1 record.
db.Table1.LoadWith(r => r.References);

Following query loads records from Table1 with References collection association loaded for each Table1 record. Also it limits loaded records.
db.Table1.LoadWith(r => r.References.Where(e => !e.IsDeleted).Take(10));

member.typeparam: Type of the related entity to be included.
member.param: A lambda expression representing navigation property to be included (t => t.Property1).
member.returns: Returns new query with related data included.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.LinqExtensions.LoadWith``2(System.Linq.IQueryable{``0},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``1}}},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{System.Linq.IQueryable{``1},System.Linq.IQueryable{``1}}})
member.summary: Specifies associations that should be loaded for each loaded record from current table. All associations, specified in expression, will be loaded. Take into account that use of this method could require multiple queries to load all requested associations. parameter could be used to define additional association loading logic like filters or loading of more associations.

para.para:
Following query loads records from Table1 with Reference association, loaded for each Table1 record.
db.Table1.LoadWith(r => r.Reference);

Following query loads records from Table1 with References collection association loaded for each Table1 record.
db.Table1.LoadWith(r => r.References);

member.typeparam: Type of the related entity to be included.
member.param: A lambda expression representing navigation property to be included (t => t.Property1).
Defines additional logic for association load query.
member.returns: Returns new query with related data included.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.LinqExtensions.ThenLoad``3(LinqToDB.ILoadWithQueryable{``0,``1},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``1,``2}})
member.summary: Specifies associations that should be loaded for parent association, loaded by previous LoadWith/ThenLoad call in chain. All associations, specified in expression, will be loaded. Take into account that use of this method could require multiple queries to load all requested associations.

para.para: Note that a way you access collection association record (by index, using First() method) doesn't affect query results and always select all records.

member.typeparam: Type of the related entity to be included.
member.param: A lambda expression representing navigation property to be included (t => t.Property1).
member.returns: Returns new query with related data included.

member.summary: Specifies associations that should be loaded for parent association, loaded by previous LoadWith/ThenLoad call in chain. All associations, specified in expression, will be loaded. Take into account that use of this method could require multiple queries to load all requested associations.

para.para: Note that a way you access collection association record (by index, using First() method) doesn't affect query results and always select all records.

member.typeparam: Type of the related entity to be included.
member.param: A lambda expression representing navigation property to be included (t => t.Property1).
member.returns: Returns new query with related data included.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.LinqExtensions.ThenLoad``3(LinqToDB.ILoadWithQueryable{``0,``1},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``1,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``2}}},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{System.Linq.IQueryable{``2},System.Linq.IQueryable{``2}}})
member.summary: Specifies associations that should be loaded for parent association, loaded by previous LoadWith/ThenLoad call in chain. All associations, specified in expression, will be loaded. Take into account that use of this method could require multiple queries to load all requested associations. parameter could be used to define additional association loading logic like filters or loading of more associations.

para.para: Note that a way you access collection association record (by index, using First() method) doesn't affect query results and always select all records.

Following query loads records from Table1 with References1 collection association loaded for each Table1 record with References2 collection association loaded for each record in References1, with filter over References2 record to include only records without "exclude" text in Name property.
db.Table1.LoadWith(r => r.References1).ThenLoad(r1 => r1.References2, r2 => r2.Where(rr2 => !rr2.Name.Contains("exclude")));

member.typeparam: Type of the related entity to be included.
member.param: A lambda expression representing navigation property to be included (t => t.Property1).
Defines additional logic for association load query.
member.returns: Returns new query with related data included.

This operation updates record in target table using user-defined values for target columns for each record that was matched in source and target and passes filtering with specified predicate, if it wasn't processed by previous operations. After that it removes updated records if they matched by delete predicate.
member.param: Update execution condition over target and source records.
Update record expression using target and source records. Expression should be a call to target record constructor with field/properties initializers to be recognized by API.
Delete execution condition over updated target and source records.
member.returns: Returns new merge command builder with new operation.

member.returns: Returns new merge command builder with new operation.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Linq.NoLinqCache
member.summary: Provides a scope, in which LINQ queries will not be added to a LINQ query cache. This could be used to tell linq2db to not cache queries that operate with big parametes. More details could be found here. Take into account that this class only disables adding of new query, created in its scope, to a cache. If query already present in cache - linq2db will use cached query.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Mapping.AssociationAttribute
member.summary:
Defines relation between tables or views. Could be applied to: - instance properties and fields; - instance and static methods.
For associations, defined using static methods, this mapping side defined by type of first parameter. Also, optionally, you can pass data context object as extra method parameter.
Based on association type - to one or to multiple records - result type should be target record's mapping type or collection.
By default associations are used only for joins generation in LINQ queries and will have null value for loaded records. To load data into association, you should explicitly specify it in your query using method.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.Mapping.AssociationAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Creates attribute instance.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Mapping.AssociationAttribute.Configuration
member.summary: Gets or sets mapping schema configuration name, for which this attribute should be taken into account. for standard names. Attributes with null or empty string value applied to all configurations (if no attribute found for current configuration).

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Mapping.AssociationAttribute.ThisKey
member.summary: Gets or sets comma-separated list of association key members on this side of association. Those keys will be used for join predicate generation and must be compatible with keys. You must specify keys it you do not use custom predicate (see ).

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Mapping.AssociationAttribute.OtherKey
member.summary: Gets or sets comma-separated list of association key members on another side of association. Those keys will be used for join predicate generation and must be compatible with keys. You must specify keys it you do not use custom predicate (see ).

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Mapping.AssociationAttribute.ExpressionPredicate
member.summary: Specifies static property or method without parameters, that returns join predicate expression. This predicate will be used together with / join keys, if they are specified. Predicate expression lambda function takes two parameters: this record and other record and returns boolean result.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Mapping.AssociationAttribute.Predicate
member.summary: Specifies predicate expression. This predicate will be used together with / join keys, if they are specified. Predicate expression lambda function takes two parameters: this record and other record and returns boolean result.

P:LinqToDB.Mapping.AssociationAttribute.QueryExpression

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Mapping.AssociationAttribute.CanBeNull
member.summary: Defines type of join: - inner join for CanBeNull = false; - left join for CanBeNull = true. Default value: true.

member.summary: Creates instance of class.

member.summary: Gets enum value.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Mapping.MapValue.MapValues
member.summary: Gets enum value mappings.

summary.para: Defines bidirectional mapping between enum field value, used on client and database value, stored in database and used in queries. Enumeration field could have multiple attributes.

Mapping from database value to enumeration performed when you load data from database. Linq2db will search for enumeration field with with required value. If attribute with such value is not found, you will receive error. If you cannot specify all possible values using , you can specify custom mapping using methods like .
Mapping from enumeration value performed when you save it to database or use in query. If your enum field has multiple attributes, you should mark one of them as default using property.

member.name: T:LinqToDB.Mapping.ScalarTypeAttribute
member.summary: Overrides default scalar detection for target class or structure. By default linq2db treats primitives and structs as scalar types. This attribute allows you to mark class or struct as scalar type or mark struct as non-scalar type. Also see . Note that if you marks some type as scalar, you will need to define custom mapping logic between object of that type and data parameter using methods.

member.summary:
Moves Distinct query into another subquery. Useful when preserving ordering is required, because some providers do not support DISTINCT ORDER BY.
-- before SELECT DISTINCT TAKE 10 c1, c2 FROM A ORDER BY c1 -- after SELECT TAKE 10 B.c1, B.c2 FROM ( SELECT DISTINCT c1, c2 FROM A ) B ORDER BY B.c1
member.param: Statement which may contain take/skip and Distinct modifiers.
Query filter predicate to determine if query needs processing.
member.returns: The same or modified statement when transformation has been performed.

member.summary: Replaces pagination by Window function ROW_NUMBER().
member.param: Statement which may contain take/skip modifiers.
Indicates that database supports OVER () syntax.
Indicates when transformation needed only for subqueries.
member.returns: The same or modified statement when transformation has been performed.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.SqlProvider.BasicSqlOptimizer.ReplaceTakeSkipWithRowNumber(LinqToDB.SqlQuery.SqlStatement,System.Predicate{LinqToDB.SqlQuery.SelectQuery},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Replaces pagination by Window function ROW_NUMBER().
member.param: Statement which may contain take/skip modifiers.
Indicates that database supports OVER () syntax.
Indicates when the transformation is needed
member.returns: The same or modified statement when transformation has been performed.

member.summary: Alternative mechanism how to prevent loosing sorting in Distinct queries.
member.param: Statement which may contain Distinct queries.
Query filter predicate to determine if query needs processing.
member.returns: The same or modified statement when transformation has been performed.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.SqlQuery.QueryHelper.WrapQuery``1(``0,System.Func{LinqToDB.SqlQuery.SelectQuery,LinqToDB.SqlQuery.ConvertVisitor{LinqToDB.SqlQuery.QueryHelper.WrapQueryContext},System.Int32},System.Action{System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{LinqToDB.SqlQuery.SelectQuery}},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Wraps tested query in subquery(s). Keeps columns count the same. After modification statement is equivalent semantically.
--before SELECT c1, c2 -- QA FROM A -- after (with 2 subqueries) SELECT C.c1, C.c2 -- QC FROM ( SELECT B.c1, B.c2 -- QB FROM ( SELECT c1, c2 -- QA FROM A ) B FROM ) C
member.param: Statement which may contain tested query
Delegate for testing which query needs to be enveloped. Result of delegate call tells how many subqueries needed. 0 - no changes 1 - one subquery N - N subqueries
After wrapping query this function called for prcess needed optimizations. Array of queries contains [QC, QB, QA]
Wrapped query can be not recreated for performance considerations.
member.returns: The same or modified statement when wrapping has been performed.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.SqlQuery.QueryHelper.WrapQuery``1(``0,LinqToDB.SqlQuery.SelectQuery,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Wraps by another select. Keeps columns count the same. After modification statement is equivalent symantically.
--before SELECT c1, c2 FROM A -- after SELECT B.c1, B.c2 FROM ( SELECT c1, c2 FROM A ) B
member.param: Statement which may contain tested query
Tells which select query needs enveloping
Wrapped query can be not recreated for performance considerations.
member.returns: The same or modified statement when wrapping has been performed.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.SqlQuery.QueryHelper.WrapQuery``1(``0,System.Func{LinqToDB.SqlQuery.SelectQuery,LinqToDB.SqlQuery.ConvertVisitor{LinqToDB.SqlQuery.QueryHelper.WrapQueryContext},System.Boolean},System.Action{LinqToDB.SqlQuery.SelectQuery,LinqToDB.SqlQuery.SelectQuery},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Wraps queries by another select. Keeps columns count the same. After modification statement is equivalent symantically.
member.param: Delegate for testing when query needs to be wrapped.
After enveloping query this function called for prcess needed optimizations.
Wrapped query can be not recreated for performance considerations.
member.returns: The same or modified statement when wrapping has been performed.

member.summary: The order of Arguments to be passed into the function from the method call.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Sql.ExpressionAttribute.Precedence
member.summary: Determines the priority of the expression in evaluation. Refer to .

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Sql.ExpressionAttribute.Configuration
member.summary: If null, this will be treated as the default evaluation for the expression. If set to a , It will only be used for that provider configuration.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Sql.ExpressionAttribute.ServerSideOnly
member.summary: If true The expression will only be evaluated on the database server. If it cannot, an exception will be thrown.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Sql.ExpressionAttribute.PreferServerSide
member.summary: If true a greater effort will be made to execute the expression on the DB server instead of in .NET.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Sql.ExpressionAttribute.InlineParameters
member.summary: If true inline all parameters passed into the expression.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Sql.ExpressionAttribute.ExpectExpression
member.summary: Used internally by .

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Sql.ExpressionAttribute.IsPredicate
member.summary: If true the expression is treated as a Predicate And when used in a Where clause will not have an added comparison to 'true' in the database.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Sql.ExpressionAttribute.IsAggregate
member.summary: If true, this expression represents an aggregate result Examples would be SUM(),COUNT().

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Sql.ExpressionAttribute.IsWindowFunction
member.summary: If true, this expression represents a Window Function Examples would be SUM() OVER(), COUNT() OVER().

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Sql.ExpressionAttribute.IsPure
member.summary:
If true, it notifies SQL Optimizer that expression returns same result if the same values/parameters are used. It gives optimizer additional information how to simplify query. For example ORDER BY PureFunction("Str") can be removed because PureFunction function uses constant value.
For example Random function is NOT Pure function because it returns different result all time. But expression is Pure in case of executed query. is also Pure function because it returns the same result with the same parameters.

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Sql.ExpressionAttribute.IsNullable
member.summary:
Used to determine whether the return type should be treated as something that can be null If CanBeNull is not explicitly set.
Default is , which will be treated as true

member.name: P:LinqToDB.Sql.ExpressionAttribute.CanBeNull
member.summary: If true, result can be null

member.name: M:LinqToDB.Sql.AliasExpr
member.summary: Useful for specifying place of alias when using method.
member.remarks: If contains at least one , automatic alias for the query will be not generated.
member.example:
The following calls are equivalent.
db.FromSql<int>($"select 1 as value from TableA {Sql.AliasExpr()}") db.FromSql<int>($"select 1 as value from TableA")

member.name: F:LinqToDB.TableOptions.CreateIfNotExists
member.summary:
IF NOT EXISTS option of the CREATE statement. This option will have effect only for databases that support the option.
Supported by: DB2, Firebird, Informix, MySql, Oracle, PostgreSQL, SQLite, SQL Server, Sybase ASE.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.TableOptions.DropIfExists
member.summary:
IF EXISTS option of the DROP statement. This option will have effect only for databases that support the option.
Supported by: DB2, Firebird, Informix, MySql, Oracle, PostgreSQL, SQLite, SQL Server, Sybase ASE.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.TableOptions.IsTemporary
member.summary:
Table is temporary (not visible to other sessions). This option will have effect only for databases that support temporary tables. If database supports both global and local temporary tables, local table will be used.
Supported by: DB2, Firebird, Informix, MySql, Oracle, PostgreSQL, SQLite, SQL Server, SAP Hana, Sybase ASE.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.TableOptions.IsLocalTemporaryStructure
member.summary:
Table is temporary (table structure is not visible to other sessions). This option will have effect only for databases that support temporary tables.
Supported by: DB2, Informix, MySql, PostgreSQL, SQLite, SAP Hana, SQL Server, Sybase ASE.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.TableOptions.IsGlobalTemporaryStructure
member.summary:
Table is global temporary (table structure is visible from other sessions). This option will have effect only for databases that support temporary tables.
Supported by: DB2, Firebird, Oracle, SAP Hana, SQL Server, Sybase ASE.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.TableOptions.IsLocalTemporaryData
member.summary:
Table data is temporary (table data is not visible to other sessions). This option will have effect only for databases that support temporary tables.
Supported by: DB2, Informix, MySql, PostgreSQL, SQLite, SAP Hana, SQL Server, Sybase ASE.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.TableOptions.IsGlobalTemporaryData
member.summary:
Table data is global temporary (table data is visible from other sessions). This option will have effect only for databases that support temporary tables.
Supported by: DB2, Firebird, Oracle, SAP Hana, SQL Server, Sybase ASE.

member.name: F:LinqToDB.TableOptions.IsTransactionTemporaryData
member.summary:
Table data is temporary (table data is transaction level visible). This option will have effect only for databases that support temporary tables.
Supported by: Firebird, Oracle, PostgreSQL.

member.name: M:LinqToDB.Tools.DataExtensions.RetrieveIdentity``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},LinqToDB.Data.DataConnection,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Initializes source columns, marked with or with identity values:
if column had sequence name set using and set to true, values from sequence used. Implemented for: Oracle, PostgreSQL
if table has identity configured and set to true, values from sequence used. Implemented for: SQL Server 2005+
Otherwise column initialized with values, incremented by 1 starting with max value from database for this column plus 1.
member.param: Ordered list of entities to initialize.
Data connection to use to retrieve sequence values of max used value for column.
Enables identity values retrieval from sequence for columns with sequence name specified in mapping using . Implemented for Oracle and PostgreSQL.
Enables identity values retrieval from table with identity column. Implemented for SQL Server 2005+.
member.returns: Returns new collection of identity fields initialized or if entity had no identity columns.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TupleElementNamesAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the use of on a member is meant to be treated as a tuple with element names.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TupleElementNamesAttribute.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Specifies, in a pre-order depth-first traversal of a type's construction, which occurrences are meant to carry element names.
member.remarks: This constructor is meant to be used on types that contain an instantiation of that contains element names. For instance, if C is a generic type with two type parameters, then a use of the constructed type C{, might be intended to treat the first type argument as a tuple with element names and the second as a tuple without element names. In which case, the appropriate attribute specification should use a transformNames value of { "name1", "name2", null, null, null }.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TupleElementNamesAttribute.TransformNames
member.summary: Specifies, in a pre-order depth-first traversal of a type's construction, which elements are meant to carry element names.

member.name: T:System.IStructTupleInternal
member.summary: Helper so we can call some tuple methods recursively without knowing the underlying types.

member.name: T:System.ValueTuple
member.summary: The ValueTuple types (from arity 0 to 8) comprise the runtime implementation that underlies tuples in C# and struct tuples in F#. Aside from created via language syntax, they are most easily created via the ValueTuple.Create factory methods. The System.ValueTuple types differ from the System.Tuple types in that: - they are structs rather than classes, - they are mutable rather than readonly, and - their members (such as Item1, Item2, etc) are fields rather than properties.

member.name: M:System.ValueTuple`2.System#Collections#IStructuralEquatable#Equals(System.Object,System.Collections.IEqualityComparer)

An object that defines the method to use to evaluate whether the two objects are equal.
member.returns: if the current instance is equal to the specified object; otherwise, .
member.remarks:
This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the instance is cast to an interface.
The implementation is called only if other is not , and if it can be successfully cast (in C#) or converted (in Visual Basic) to a whose components are of the same types as those of the current instance. The IStructuralEquatable.Equals(Object, IEqualityComparer) method first passes the values of the objects to be compared to the implementation. If this method call returns , the method is called again and passed the values of the two instances.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method builds string by format pattern and (optional) arguments. Parameter, which contains format string, should be given in constructor. The format string should be in -like form.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: Specifies which parameter of an annotated method should be treated as format-string

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.UsedImplicitlyAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked symbol is used implicitly (e.g. via reflection, in external library), so this symbol will not be marked as unused (as well as by other usage inspections).

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.MeansImplicitUseAttribute
member.summary: Should be used on attributes and causes ReSharper to not mark symbols marked with such attributes as unused (as well as by other usage inspections)

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Access
member.summary: Only entity marked with attribute considered used.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Assign
member.summary: Indicates implicit assignment to a member.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedWithFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type with fixed constructor signature. That means any unused constructor parameters won't be reported as such.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedNoFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags
member.summary: Specify what is considered used implicitly when marked with or .

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.Members
member.summary: Members of entity marked with attribute are considered used.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.WithMembers
member.summary: Entity marked with attribute and all its members considered used.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.PublicAPIAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is intended to mark publicly available API which should not be removed and so is treated as used.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.InstantHandleAttribute
member.summary: Tells code analysis engine if the parameter is completely handled when the invoked method is on stack. If the parameter is a delegate, indicates that delegate is executed while the method is executed. If the parameter is an enumerable, indicates that it is enumerated while the method is executed.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.PureAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a method does not make any observable state changes. The same as System.Diagnostics.Contracts.PureAttribute.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.LinqTunnelAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that method is pure LINQ method, with postponed enumeration (like Enumerable.Select, .Where). This annotation allows inference of [InstantHandle] annotation for parameters of delegate type by analyzing LINQ method chains.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.NoEnumerationAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that IEnumerable, passed as parameter, is not enumerated.
